features: Moisturizing Hair Conditioner: Instantly restores, revitalizes and repairs dry hair with weightless hydration that leaves hair incredibly soft, shiny and silky smooth for days; Suitable for all hair types;
Tropical Coconut Mango Scent: The rich aroma of tropical mango swirled with juicy papaya over a creamy background of coconut milk and smooth vanilla bean will leave you feeling uplifted.

Naturally Derived Ingredients: Enriched with our special blend of vitamins, pure essential oils and botanical extracts to lock in moisture and nourish dry hair. Toxin-free formula is paraben, sulfate, phosphate and gluten-free.
Cruelty-Free Hair Care: Ginger Lily Farms Botanicals is PETA-certified, 100% vegan and never tested on animals so you can feel good while using it.

Environmentally Friendly: Refill size helps reduce plastic consumption and is perfect for salon backbars or refilling shower dispensers in locker rooms, hotels, spas or at home. (1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz.)
body.description: Ginger Lily Farms Botanicals Coco Mango Moisturizing Conditioner smooths, restores and revitalizes dry hair with lasting moisture for incredibly soft, shiny hair. Formulated with aloe, flaxseed and sunflower seed to provide weightless hydration to all hair types. Our moisturizing conditioner works with your hair’s natural oils to deeply penetrate every hair strand and improve the overall health, look and feel of your hair. Dry hair is instantly restored and revitalized. Ginger Lily Farms Botanical Hair Conditioner is formulated without parabens, sulfates, phosphates, gluten. The cruelty-free conditioner is 100% vegan and PETA certified. Recommended for commercial use in locker rooms, hair salons, and home use for refills. Directions: Massage Ginger Lily Farms Botanicals Moisturizing Conditioner into damp hair after cleansing with Ginger Lily Farms Botanicals Moisturizing Shampoo. Rinse thoroughly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I really wanted to love this, it's ok
reviews.reviewText: Here is the truth. I don't write many reviews. I was looking forward to a new shampoo and conditioner. One that smelled great, worked well and didn't cost a fortune.The smell is good. It didn't last long after like I was hoping. Not a big deal. I only bought the conditioner to try first before getting the shampoo too. That might make a difference on the longevity of the smell.It gives a nice clean feel. The main problem is that it leaves my hair tangled as if I didn't use any conditioner. My hair is baby fine. Maybe it works better on different type of hair? I use a detangler after and that solved it. Then use a leave in conditioner once a week.I didn't tell my husband I switched conditioner. I refilled our bottle with a pump. After a few times using it. He made the comment to me the conditioner didn't work as well as it was. I didn't even ask him. After I told him I had switched, he said "He felt it didn't moisturize it and left it tangled".I hope this helps anyone who is thinking about it. If your hair doesn't have an issue tangling, then give it a try. If it does this isn't for you. I am going to try the bodywash. I did like the smell.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I feel bad leaving a review like this….
reviews.reviewText: But this product was genuinely just not what I was hoping and expecting it would be.I use a ton of conditioner. Recently upon searching “bulk conditioner” on here I happened upon this product.“Omg! Perfect! Great price, cruelty free, massive amount, a scent I was sure to like. This is perfect!”, I thought. And the company seems really cool, ethical, etc.It arrived exactly as expected and WOW the smell was great! I was actually excited to use it. Well… unfortunately it fell really flat of what I was expecting based on all the great reviews.I shampooed and rinsed my hair, then slathered the ponytail sections with a handful of this conditioner to let it work it’s magic while I completed the rest of my shower tasks. Towards the end of my shower, I began to run my fingers through the ends to detangle my hair before rinsing. To my surprise, the tangles weren’t budging. My hair felt dry and knotted, as if I’d used no conditioner at all. I added some more and tried to detangle… nothing. It was like the more I added, the more tangled and dry it became. It felt as though my hair had been soaked in pool water.Eventually I gave up, rinsed it out, and concluded my shower.I could not believe the condition my hair was in. It was a veritable birds nest. It felt “chemical-y”, dry, damaged, and as if it could snap and break. Like I said earlier: that feeling of soaking one’s hair all day in highly chlorinated pool water.I had to use like 1/4 cup of leave in conditioner to get the tangles out. I ended up ripping out a LOT of hair in the process. Thankfully Amazon is letting me return it.In summation, I feel bad leaving this rating. The company seems lovely- good values, an array of products, and cruelty free which is very important to me as a consumer.This conditioner just ain’t it though. Maybe I got an unusually bad batch, but my hair caught some damage and ended up worse after using this product sadly.
